Column2:
Would you like to use 'Simple' or 'Advanced' controls?
For both types of controls, the aircraft is controlled with the mouse buttons, and the throttle is controlled with the mouse wheel.
Simple: WS keys and the Up/Down arrows control the throttle, AD+QE keys control the roll and the heading.
Advanced: WASD+QE keys (and the arrows) control the aircraft direction, LShift+LCtrl control the throttle
Column3:
Would you like to use 'Simple' or 'Advanced' controls?
For both types of controls, the aircraft is controlled with the mouse buttons, and the throttle is controlled with the mouse wheel.
Simple: WS keys and the Up/Down arrows control the throttle, AD+QE keys control the roll and the heading.
Advanced: WASD+QE keys (and the arrows) control the aircraft direction, LShift+LCtrl control the throttle

Column2: For destroying enemy vehicles in battles against other players, you receive points, which may be used to fly out in an attacker or a bomber.
Column3: For destroying enemy vehicles in battles against other players, you receive points, which may be used to fly out in an attacker or a bomber.

Column2: In order to fly out, use the button assigned for this action (the button is indicated above the aircraft icon). Start will take place after a short countdown, during which other players will be able to join you.
Column3: In order to fly out, use the button assigned for this action (the button is indicated above the aircraft icon). Start will take place after a short countdown, during which other players will be able to join you.

Column2: Only one bomber or attacker can be in the air at the same time, therefore, flyout in a bomber or attacker may be unavailable even if you have accumulated enough points for it.
Column3: Only one bomber or attacker can be in the air at the same time, therefore, flyout in a bomber or attacker may be unavailable even if you have accumulated enough points for it.

Column2: However, in this case you can join your ally's flyout in a fighter before the countdown to the start has completed.
Column3: However, in this case you can join your ally's flyout in a fighter before the countdown to the start has completed.

Column2: Here you can see how many allies take part in the flyout; the number of participants is limited.
Column3: Here you can see how many allies take part in the flyout; the number of participants is limited.

Column2: The points received for destroying enemy vehicles are spent on each flyout.
Column3: The points received for destroying enemy vehicles are spent on each flyout.

Column2: Flyout time is limited, and the time left is indicated in the bottom left corner of the screen.
Column3: Flyout time is limited, and the time left is indicated in the bottom left corner of the screen.

Column2: When you start or join a flyout, your vehicle stays in the place where you left it and can be destroyed. If the vehicle remains undamaged by the end of the flyout, you will be returned to it.
Column3: When you start or join a flyout, your vehicle stays in the place where you left it and can be destroyed. If the vehicle remains undamaged by the end of the flyout, you will be returned to it.
